ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Bard Training in Kunark and Fabian???
ygData.msgSnippet: hehe, kinda reminds me of this weekend, we were in fear, and went after Cazic thule. tactic was send in a druid, snare cazic and then wiat for him to get Death
ygData.messageBody:
hehe, kinda reminds me of this weekend, we were in fear, and went after
Cazic thule. tactic was send in a druid, snare cazic and then wiat for him
to get Death touched. So everyone's yelling for the druid to go go go. so he
runs up, snares the stupid god, and starts kiting him, a minute or 2 later
everyone's like wtf is he doing. the druid is still alive and running around
in circles kiting a bloody god. was the funniest concept i have ever seen, i
was laughing off my chair. Damn druids think they can kite anything. he
finally got death touched and everyone charged in

on a side note, wizards were really happy to finally use their AE spells for
once, they killed 8 cazic pets real quick with em hehe.

i dunno, it was just one of the funniest things i've seen so far in eq.

/applaud the halfling druid
/laugh at the halfling UbEr DrOOd Kiter

fyi, cazic dropped junk, 2 puppet strings and a shaman hammer

-Rakka
Sol Ro


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cranfill, Wendy [SMTP:Wendy_Cranfill@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, June 21, 2000 12:16 PM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Bard Training in Kunark and Fabian???
>
> I agree with you Sylly...
>
> I've about had it playing my shaman, I love her to death but the politics,
> guild fights and extreme boredom are not worth the few hours of exciting
> fun
> in Sebilis anymore. The most fun lately I've had is with my bard, killing
> stuff in Lake of Ill Omen with pickup groups... I've actually laughed for
> the first time in ages when our untwinked puller (25th warrior in BRONZE)
> pulled like 10 sarnaks, and as much as I yelled "assist xxx" everyone hit
> their own sarnak, the enchanter messed himself, and we all ended up
> running
> amok... some to the zone, some in crazy circles...
>
> It was insane, incompetant, dangerous, and the situation with Halana would
> have made me crazy mad.. but with Tani, I had the most fun and laughed so
> hard pepsi shot out my nose.
>
> Halana, 53rd (ok i'm hedging a bit) Shaman
> Tani, 25th Bard
> Solusek Ro
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Sylly Songsynger [mailto:jgs@...]
> > Sent: Wednesday, June 21, 2000 10:08 AM
> > To: eqbards@egroups.com
> > Subject: Re: [eqbards] Bard Training in Kunark and Fabian???
> >
> >
> > Heh - ya, I know. I have reached that stage in EQ where you get kinda
> > "bitter" about some things. I dont think I have it as bad as
> > some others I
> > know - and I still keep playing. But....(and these are my
> > feelings - imho,
> > ymmv, yadda yadda)
> >
> > 1. There is a strong "Us vs Them" atmosphere in EQ. Us being
> > Verant and the
> > "Vision(tm)" and the "You have been summoned by the Gods (who
> > in r/l maybe a
> > some volunteer with little or no customer service
> > exp/training and a short
> > fuse)" and the Them being the players (who are probably
> > lying, cheating,
> > coniving, theiving baistiages or else why would they be
> > asking for a res /
> > item that got lost doing a quest / help finding a corpse /
> > return of items
> > from rotted corpse when printed user manual has incorrect
> > times for corpse
> > decay / etc etc.).
> >
> > 2. Advancement in the game is based on "time served" 10 times
> > more than
> > "skilled play." And this makes 80 to 90 percent of the game
> > very boring.
> > Only new places offer some relief and granted the design of
> > them has gotten
> > better - still after doing Seb Crypt 10 times - it gets
> > boring. Camping for
> > exp is flat out boring. How many hows killing aviaks / pickclaws /
> > froogluks / kobolds / guards / etc. etc. can you stand? This
> > may be due to
> > fighting "npc's" rather than live ppl where each fight is
> > dynamic. So, the
> > basis of the game maybe just boring because any AI in the NPC's is so
> > limited - and repetitive.
> >
> > 3. The "content" based events/quests/lore & history has been
> > skimpy at best.
> > Granted, it's very difficult to provide RolePlay Lore when
> > there are so many
> > Duuuudz who wanna kill it and loot it. But where is the incentive for
> > players to do otherwise? Where are the tools to facilitate GM
> > events? And
> > they may not have the resources to make dynamic events
> > actually work - ie
> > why bother if there is no money in it.
> >
> > So, any how - I had a great year in the game. The part i
> > love the best is
> > the other players. I know there are a couple others who play
> > the game to
> > "live in the world" (Silky? Peace? Sylly? oh that's me!) and
> > there is fun
> > stuff there. I have had as much fun taking "newbies" in
> > Rivervale to the
> > Sheriff, levitating and running to the rocks so we can climb
> > to the top of
> > the mountains - as I have had doing dragons and planes.
> > Maybe more fun.
> >
> > So, for the younger bards reading this, take your time and
> > play the way you
> > like. There is a lot of fun out there. Only when you join
> > the quest for
> > exp race and leet loots, remember to smell the roses too.
> > All you have to
> > do to get to level 50 is kill 1,210,314 moss snakes, skellies, aviaks,
> > pickclaws, froogs, kobolds, specs, etc, etc, etc. It's a
> > long haul but
> > eventually you get there.
> >
> > Sylly Songsynger
> > <The Pantheon>
> > Minstrel somewhere on Innoruuk...
> > http://www.sba.uwm.edu/jgs/sylly
> >
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: "Kevin L. Crawford" <Lyrnia@...>
> > To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> > Sent: Wednesday, June 21, 2000 8:59 AM
> > Subject: Re: [eqbards] Bard Training in Kunark and Fabian???
> >
> >
> > > Hehe
> > >
> > > Dang sylly ;) Don't mince words man! Tell us how you
> > really feel :)
> > >
> > > **grins and runs before Sylly can catch her**
> > >
> > > Lyrnia Jongleur
> > > Bard of Norrath
> > >
> >
